title: Trump urges Cambodia, Thailand to honour ceasefire as fighting reignites
byline: US President Donald Trump expects Cambodia and Thailand to “fully honor” their ceasefire commitments following renewed clashes along their disputed border that has forced thousands of people to flee, a senior administration official said on Monday (Dec 8).

title: Heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: The Northeast monsoon conditions are gradually establishing over the island, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Level 3 (Red) landslide evacuation warning issued to several areas in four districts
byline: The Disaster Management Center (DMC) has instructed District Secretaries to evacuate people living in landslide-prone areas in the districts of Kandy, Kegalle, Kurunegala, and Matale to designated safe centers.

title: Irrigation Dept. lowers several reservoir water levels ahead of expected rainfall
byline: The Department of Irrigation reports that water levels in several major reservoirs across the country are being further reduced in response to rainfall forecasts for the coming days.

title: Advisory issued for heavy rainfall above 100 mm
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an ‘Amber’ advisory for heavy rainfall above 100 millimeters over the next 24 hours in parts of the island.

title: Trump warns of new tariffs on India, says they should not “Dump Rice” in US
byline: US President Donald Trump has warned that he may introduce new tariffs on agricultural imports, especially on rice imports from India and fertiliser from Canada, as trade talks with both countries continue without major progress.

title: Measures implemented to register deaths of persons reported dead or missing after Cyclone ‘Ditwah’
byline: The Registrar General’s Department of Sri Lanka has announced that the necessary legal provisions have been implemented to register the deaths of individuals who died or went missing due to landslides and floods caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Youth murdered with sharp weapon over financial dispute in Panadura
byline: A youth has been murdered with a sharp weapon in the Walana Road area of the Panadura South Police Division, according to police.

title: Thailand-Cambodia fighting spreads along contested border as civilian toll rises
byline: Fighting between Cambodia and Thailand escalated along their contested border on Dec 9, as the South-east Asian neighbours both said they would not back down in defending their sovereignty.

title: Special mobile service to assist owners of disaster-damaged vehicles: DMT
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) states that information is currently being collected regarding vehicles destroyed and damaged due to the disaster situation caused by Cyclone Ditwah in Sri Lanka.

title: Former Assistant Government Analyst further remanded
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the further remand of the former Assistant Government Analyst, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) on corruption charges, until December 22.

title: Sri Lanka’s death toll due to Cyclone Ditwah climbs to 638
byline: The death toll due to the adverse weather conditions experienced in the country in the past few days caused by Cyclone Ditwah has increased to 638 as of today (09), the Disaster Management Center (DMC) has confirmed.

title: Over 5,000 houses completely destroyed across Sri Lanka by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The total number of houses completely destroyed across Sri Lanka due to the severe disaster situation caused by Cyclone Ditwah has surpassed 5,000, according to the latest report issued by the Disaster Management Centre (DMC).

title: Health officials warn of potential spread of eye diseases in safe shelters
byline: The College of Ophthalmologists of Sri Lanka (COSL) has issued a warning regarding the potential spread of eye diseases in safe shelters housing individuals affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: One-fifth of Sri Lanka inundated by cyclone Ditwah - UNDP analysis
byline: An estimated 2.3 million people – more than half of them women – were living in areas flooded by Cyclone Ditwah that struck Sri Lanka on 28 November.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in the Sabaragamuwa, Western and Southern provinces and in Kurunegala district, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Former Chairman of SLBFE Mohammed Hilmi granted bail
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the release on bail of the former Chairman of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE), Mohammed Hilmi who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) in connection with an alleged corruption charge.

title: New Basnayake Nilame of Ruhunu Maha Kataragama Devalaya appointed
byline: Thilina Madushanka has been appointed as the Basnayake Nilame of the Ruhunu Maha Kataragama Devalaya, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: NBRO extends landslide warnings, identifies 15,000 high-risk areas
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) reports that about 15,000 landslide-prone locations have been identified across the country, and nearly 5,000 families residing in those high-risk areas have already been relocated.

title: Indian Army speeds up bridge repairs, medical aid in Sri Lanka under Op Sagar Bandhu
byline: The Indian Army has stepped up its humanitarian assistance in Sri Lanka following Cyclone Ditwah, accelerating bridge restoration work and expanding medical support under Operation Sagar Bandhu.

title: President Anura Kumara expresses gratitude to Donald Trump for standing with Sri Lanka
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has expressed his gratitude to U.S. President Donald Trump for standing with Sri Lanka yet again at a time of need.

title: A/L exam to resume on Jan. 12
byline: The Ministry of Education has announced that the 2025 GCE Advanced Level Examination will resume on January 12, 2026.

title: Over 2,000 Navy personnel promoted in view of Navy’s 75th anniversary
byline: A total of 17 Navy officers and 2,069 senior and junior sailors have been promoted to their next rank in view of Sri Lanka Navy’s 75th anniversary celebrations.

title: Another Indian relief aircraft arrives with bailey bridge and medical supplies
byline: Another aircraft carrying a consignment of disaster relief humanitarian aid from India arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this afternoon (09).

title: India deploys another helicopter for disaster rescue operations in Sri Lanka
byline: A MI-17 helicopter provided by the Indian government arrived at the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) Base in Katunayake at 11.50 a.m. today (09), following the return of two previously deployed MI-17 helicopters to India for essential maintenance.

title: Yellow anaconda hatchling goes missing from Dehiwala Zoo
byline: A Yellow Anaconda hatchling has reportedly gone missing from the Dehiwala National Zoological Gardens.

title: Google and Apple team up to enhance Android-iPhone switching
byline: Google and Apple have long existed as polar opposites, each ruling over their tech kingdoms with little interest in cooperation.

title: UN pledges US$4.5 million to support Sri Lankans affected by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The United Nations has allocated US$4.5 million (LKR 1.38 billion) from the Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF) to strengthen Sri Lanka’s response to Cyclone Ditwah, which made landfall on 28 November.

title: ASPI gains 439 points during today’s trading
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed above the 22,000-point mark after gaining more than 430 points during today’s trading.

title: 223,000 motorcycles, 55,000 cars and 13,000 three-wheelers registered in 2025 – DMT
byline: Motorcycles account for the highest number of vehicle registrations recorded so far this year (2025), the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) has stated.

title: Qatar underscores commitment to continue humanitarian role in Sri Lanka
byline: The State of Qatar has underscored its commitment to continuing its humanitarian role and supporting its partners in Sri Lanka to ensure an effective and sustainable response to communities affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: 3 Idiots 2: Sequel with original cast set to begin filming in 2026
byline: One of India’s most recognisable films, 3 Idiots, is set for a sequel nearly 15 years after it first arrived in cinemas.

title: Sluice gate of Upper Kotmale Reservoir opened
byline: A sluice gate of the Upper Kotmale Reservoir has been opened due to rains in catchment areas, the Department of Irrigation has announced.

title: All schools in Western, Southern, Northern, Sabaragamuwa, Eastern and North-Central provinces to reopen on Monday
byline: All schools in the Western, Southern, Northern, Sabaragamuwa, Eastern and North-Central provinces will reopen for academic activities on Monday (16), the Secretary to the Ministry of Education has announced.

title: Fairly heavy showers above 75 mm predicted for Northern and North-Central provinces
byline: The Northeast monsoon conditions have established over the island, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: International airlines expect to transport record 5.2 billion passengers in 2026: IATA
byline: International airlines expect to transport a record 5.2 billion passengers in 2026 despite global headwinds affecting the sector, the industry’s trade association said on Tuesday.

title: Sri Lanka’s death toll from adverse weather continues to climb, 203 still missing
byline: The death toll due to the adverse weather conditions experienced in the country over the past few days has climbed to 639, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) has confirmed.

title: Cyclone Ditwah causes extensive pollution along 143km stretch of Sri Lanka’s coastline
byline: A total of 143.03 kilometers of Sri Lanka’s coastline have been polluted due to heavy flooding caused by the impact of Cyclone Ditwah, according to the Marine Environment Protection Authority (MEPA).

title: National Audit Office to conduct over 3,500 audits in 2026
byline: The National Audit Office is scheduled to conduct a total of 3,508 audits in 2026.

title: Train collides with car at Piyadigama railway crossing in Galle
byline: An accident occurred when a car collided with a train at the Piyadigama railway crossing in Galle.

title: Union calls for debt relief for teachers and principals in disaster-affected areas
byline: The Ceylon Teachers’ Union (CTU) has urged the government to introduce an immediate concessional relief programme for teachers and principals affected by the recent disaster situation.

title: EU releases €1.8 million in emergency assistance for Sri Lanka
byline: The European Union has released €1.8 million in emergency assistance for Sri Lanka, in response to the devastating landslide and floods in recent days.

title: Co-pilot of helicopter that crashed into Gin Oya in Lunuwila testifies in court
byline: Flight Lieutenant Eranga Chamara Ekanayake, the co-pilot of the Sri Lanka Air Force Bell 212 aircraft that crashed into the Gin Oya in Lunuwila, Wennappuwa, has stated in court that both the main pilot and he realized there was a technical defect in the aircraft before it crashed.

title: Landslide evacuation warning issued to several areas in four districts extended
byline: The ‘Level-3’ (Red) landslide evacuation warning issued to multiple areas in four districts has been extended.

title: Fire breaks out at seven-storey building in Indonesia’s Jakarta, 20 dead
byline: A fire broke out at a seven-storey building in Indonesia’s capital Jakarta on Tuesday, an official said on Tuesday, with 20 people confirmed dead.

title: Govt urges public not to share personnel information with unauthorized individuals
byline: The general public has been requested not to be misled by fraudulent messages and to refrain from sharing personal information with individuals who claimed to be involved in programmes to provide relief to those affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Australia social media ban takes effect in world first
byline: Australia at midnight (1300 GMT) on Wednesday became the first country in the world to ban social media for children under 16, blocking them from platforms including TikTok, Alphabet’s YouTube and Meta’s Instagram and Facebook.

title: 9,926 schools to reopen on Tuesday, 147 to remain closed - Education Ministry
byline: All schools in the Western, Southern, Northern, Sabaragamuwa, Eastern and North-Central provinces will reopen for academic activities on Tuesday (16), the Secretary to the Ministry of Education, Nalaka Kaluwewe has announced.

title: Office trains from Rambukkana, Polgahawela and Kurunegala to resume tomorrow
byline: The Department of Railways has announced that several office trains on the main line will resume operations tomorrow (10).
